alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 1:54PM MDT until May 27 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE CAMERON PEAK BURN AREA... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer, and specifically the Cameron Peak burn area. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and steep canyons. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cedar Creek, Cow Creek, Pendergrass Creek, Eld Creek, Elkhorn Creek, Manhattan Creek, Pennock Creek, Dry Creek, Buckhorn Creek, Little Beaver Creek, Grouse Creek, Black Creek, Bennett Creek, South Lone Pine Creek, North Fork Fish Creek, Miller Fork and Sheep Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pennock Pass, Rustic, Glen Haven, the Retreat, Storm Mountain, Upper Buckhorn, Lazy D Ranch, and Monument Gulch.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads and roadside culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
